author: Taylor Hurt
description: Find out more about Taylor's developer profile and recent projects.
title: Developer Profile for Taylor Hurt

contents.p: This is a brief presentation about my background and recent projects.

ul: +2 yrs. experience in HTML, CSS, Javascript
+2 yrs. experience serving clients in a technical support role
Experience in webspace accessibility and optimization
Proficient at making nodejs utilities and build tools
Knowledgable in provisioning and managing remote servers
Domain knowledge in molecular biology and genetics

contents.p: This mock landing page was created to responsively adjust to different screen sizes, including mobile screens. The original design was created by a graphic designer and this project converted it into a responsive webpage. Sass was used to improve organization of the styles.
View the website⇗
Tags: Semantic HTML, Responsive Design, Sass

This project allows you to create simple web presentations with just a few lines of JSON. The responsive design makes your presentation look good on small and large screens. In addition, the compile-time script generates a favicon to match the presentation background.
For more info, see the repo⇗
Tags: Semantic HTML, Responsive Design, JSON, Handlebars
Many functions in the Ramda library can be difficult to explain in words. This project improved the library's documentation with the creation of an input/output notation similar to Mathematica.
For more info, see the repo⇗
Tags: Functional Programming, Documentation, Handlebars, Open-Source Development

The existing Ramda REPL suffered from an inflexible layout, making it unusable for users with smaller screen sizes. This project increased screen real estate and used Bootstrap to enable responsive layout adjustments at smaller screen sizes.
Try the REPL⇗
Tags: Responsive Design, Bootstrap, Open-Source Development

In addition to a responsive design, this practical application exemplifies MVVM and PubSub architecture. The Note model provides a Data Access Layer to localStorage and the View Models contain the logic to perform DOM updates.
Try the demo⇗
Tags: MVVM, PubSub, Bootstrap, Responsive Design, UX Design, localStorage
A custom UX/UI was created and integrated with the graph library Springy to create this interactive graphing application. Graphs can be saved and loaded from the user's filesystem.

Try the demo⇗
requires large screen size
Tags: UX/UI Design, Graphs, Canvas, Filesystem Storage

The idea of this product assembler is to automatically create form elements and add input type checking based the structure of a single JSON product schema. The MVC architecture is followed in the code.
Try the demo⇗
Tags: Schemas, Forms, MVC
This weekend project attempts to recreate the classic Snakes game. The game board is responsive to window size so try adjusting it and then refresh to play at different sizes.

Try the demo⇗
requires arrow keys
Tags: Canvas, Game, AI

This small demo resulted from exploring virtual dom, immutability, and single data state. It shows the beginnings of a visual content-editing space, where the user could create and save new components or create macros for component functions.
Try the demo⇗
Tags: Components, Single Data State, Virtual DOM, Immutability, localStorage
This graphical wireframe was created in Photoshop and then turned into a functional website with HTML and CSS.
Click the image to see a larger view.
Tags: Wireframe, Photoshop, Custom Graphics
This graphical wireframe was created in Photoshop and then turned into a functional website with HTML and CSS.
Click the image to see a larger.
Tags: Wireframe, Photoshop, Custom Graphics

ul: ES6, jQuery, Angular, RxJS, Ramda, Handlebars, Mocha/Chai, Test-Driven Development
JSON, Semantic HTML, Responsive Design, Sass, Bootstrap, Photoshop
MVC, MVVM, PubSub, Immutability, Virtual DOM, Functional Programming
git, npm, nodejs, Babel, Express.js, Joi, RAML, Swagger
nginx, SSL certs, MySQL, CouchDB, ArangoDB, RethinkDB
Bash scripting, Regexps, LXC virtual containers
Linux administration, remote ssh, cron, rsync

contents.p: Thanks for taking the time to learn more about me. If you would like to see more, you can find repos for all of my projects on GitHub.
I'm available for full-time, part-time, or contract work. I look forward to hearing from you!

My Github Profile⇗
taylor.a.hurt@gmail.com
Tampa Bay Area
